meta.title: Coronavirus (COVID-19) -

input.name: q
input.placeholder: What can we help you find?

div.p: Kaufman ISD schools will remain closed indefinitely.Â In the event that we will be able to return to school, we will notify families a week in advance.Â We will continue to provide more information as it becomes available.Â All activities for April have been cancelled.Â Please stay tuned as we will continue to post on our social media outlets and website.Â Keep learning Lions!

video.div: Your web browser does not support the <video> tag.

div.p: El Distrito Escolar de Kaufman permanecerÃ¡ cerrado indefinidamente. En caso de que sea posible regresar a clases, nos comunicaremos con las familias una semana con anticipaciÃ³n. Continuaremos proveyendo mÃ¡s informaciÃ³n conforme estÃ© disponible. Todas las actividades del mes de Abril han sido suspendidas. Por favor siga en contacto por medio de las redes sociales y pÃ¡gina web.Â ContinÃºen aprendiendo âLionsâ!

li.a: Kaufman ISD Update - digital learning, meal service, and more - 03/23/20

h2.a: Kaufman ISD Update - digital learning, meal service, and more - 03/23/20

header.h2: Kaufman ISD Update - digital learning, meal service, and more - 03/23/20

video.div: Your web browser does not support the <video> tag.

ul.li:
Tomorrow, our teachers will BE calling every studentâs family in the district. Please answer calls from unknown numbers. We need to gather information to better serve you and your familyâs needs as well as give you information that is specific to your student.
Your student should have received instructional materials the Friday before spring break.

If your child was absent the Friday before Spring Break, instructional materials will be available in the foyer of each campus and labeled by grade level or course at the high school. They will be available for pickup tomorrow and Wednesday from 9:00 a.m. â 7:00 p.m. The inner doors will be locked and you will not be able to access the building.
The district will be launching digital lessons beginning Monday, March 30th, more information will be released later this week.

Meal service began today. If you would like meal delivery and did not receive it today, please email lunchrequest@kaufman-isd.net. Curbside pick up is also available at Kaufman High School Cafeteria from 8:00-9:00 am for breakfast and 11:00-12:30 for lunch.

We realize that we are in unchartered waters and we want to make sure our instruction is focused on student learning. We also realize the burden that has been placed on our parents and older siblings. Given that, we are asking our teachers to focus on innovative digital learning and we will not be taking grades on the assignments during this time. Instead, teachers will be connecting with their students on digital platforms to provide feedback. We do ask that parents work alongside us to encourage your student to interact and participate in digital lessons. This does not apply to dual credit courses that will be assigned grades through TVCC.
Be looking for remind text messages from your teachers and campuses, if you are not signed up for remind â we will be posting instruction and details for each teacherâs remind account.

MaÃ±ana, nuestras maestras llamaran por telÃ©fono a las familias de cada estudiante en el distrito. Por favor contesten estas llamadas ya que quizÃ¡ serÃ¡n nÃºmeros desconocidos. Necesitamos obtener informaciÃ³n para poder servirle mejor a usted y su familia y darle informaciÃ³n especifica referente a su estudiante(s)
Su estudiante debiÃ³ haber recibido materiales de instrucciÃ³n el viernes pasado antes de las vacaciones de primavera.

Si su estudiante falto a la escuela el viernes antes de las vacaciones de primavera, los materiales de instrucciÃ³n estarÃ¡n disponibles en la entrada (vestÃ­bulo) de su escuela. Los materiales estarÃ¡n separados por grado en la primaria o por curso si asisten a la High School. Puede pasar a recogerlos maÃ±ana y miÃ©rcoles de 9:00 am - 7:00 pm. Las puertas interiores para entrar a la es-cuela estarÃ¡n cerradas y no podrÃ¡ ingresar al edificio.
El distrito estarÃ¡ lanzando lecciones digitales comenzando el Lunes, 30 de Marzo. RecibirÃ¡ mas informaciÃ³n en el transcurso de la semana.

El servicio de alimentos comenzÃ³ hoy. Si desea recibir el alimento en casa y no lo recibiÃ³ hoy, por favor envÃ­e un mensaje a lunchrequest@kaufman-isd.net. TambiÃ©n hay alimentos disponi-bles para pasar a recogerlos a la cafeterÃ­a de la escuela High School de 8:00-9:00 am para el de-sayuno y 11:00-12:30 el almuerzo.

Sabemos que estamos navegando por aguas turbulentas y queremos asegurarnos que nuestra instrucciÃ³n esta enfocada en el aprendizaje del estudiante. Entendemos que se ha puesto una gran responsabilidad sobre los padres y hermanos mayores. Por esta razÃ³n, le pedimos a nues-tras maestras (os) que enfoquen sus lecciones en aprendizaje digital e innovador sin tomar en cuenta calificaciones durante este tiempo. Mas bien, las maestras (os) estarÃ¡n conectando con sus estudiantes por medio de plataformas digitales para dar apoyo acadÃ©mico. Le pedimos a los padres de familia que por favor nos ayuden a motivar a los estudiantes a interactuar y participar en estas lecciones digitales. Esto no aplica a cursos del colegio comunitario el cual asignara califi-caciones por medio de TVCC.

Este al tanto de los mensajes de texto que se estarÃ¡n enviando como recordatorios de parte de su maestra (o) y escuela. Si aun no esta registrado para remind estaremos publicando las in-strucciones y detalles de cada maestra (o).

video.div: Your web browser does not support the <video> tag.

header.h2: Kaufman ISD - School Closing Announcement - Spanish 3/17/20

video.div: Your web browser does not support the <video> tag.

br.br: This is an update on the KISD lunch and breakfast program during the COVID-19 school closure.Â Â Beginning Monday, March 23rd, all KISD students, PK-12th grade, may participate in the breakfast and lunch program.Â Â You have two options in which you can participate, either curbside pickup at KHS Cafeteria or bus delivery.Â Â Your first option will be curbside pickup at KHS.Â Â Breakfast will be served Monday - Friday from 8 - 9 a.m. and lunch will be served from 11 a.m. - 12:30 p.m.Â Â Your second option will be bus delivery.

div.br: Deliveries will be made Monday-Friday between 10:30 and 12:30 depending on where you live.Â Â Because we are currently short on packaging products, we will only be delivering lunch by bus for the first week.Â Â Of course you may participate in curbside breakfast pickup at KHS during the first week.Â Â Beginning March 30th, bus deliveries will be both breakfast and lunch.Â Â Initial bus deliveries will be to the homes of students that have been riding the bus in the mornings.

If you have a student that has not been riding a morning bus, but would like to participate in the breakfast and lunch bus delivery, please send a detailed email with your name, your student(s) name and address toÂ lunchrequest@kaufman-isd.net.Â Â Once you have submitted your information, your student(s) will be added to the bus delivery list and deliveries will begin with 1 to 2 days of notification.

It is important to know that in order for your child to participate in the bus breakfast and lunch delivery, he or she must be physically present at the time of delivery.Â Â Breakfast and lunches will not be left at homes where no one is present.Â Â KISD would like to thank you for letting us serve you and your children during this difficult time.Â Â Please keep watching for updates on our website and Remind for additional information.
Â

br.br: Esta es la noticia actual sobre el programa de comida de KISD durante la suspensiÃ³n de clases a causa del COVID-19. Comenzando el Lunes, 23 de Marzo, todos los estudiantes de KISD, grados PK-12, podrÃ¡n participar en el program de desayuno y almuerzo. Tenemos dos opciones, puede pasar por sus alimentos a la cafeteria de la escuela High School para llevarlos a casa o un autobÃºs puede entregarlos a su domicilio. Su primera opciÃ³n seria pasar por sus alimentos a la escuela KHS.

div.br: El desayuno sera Lunes - Viernes de 8-9 a.m. y el almuerzo sera de las 11 a.m - 12:30 p.m. Su segunda opciÃ³n es entrega de autobÃºs. Las entregas serÃ¡n Lunes - Viernes entre 10:30 a.m y 12:30 p.m. dependiendo de donde usted viva. Debido a que actualmente nos faltan productos de empaque, solo entregaremos el almuerzo en autobÃºs durante la primera semana. Por supuesto, usted aun puede pasar a recoger su desayuno a la escuela KHS durante esta primera semana.

Comenzando el 30 de Marzo, los autobuses repartirÃ¡n ambos, desayuno y almuerzo. Las entregas iniciales del autobÃºs serÃ¡n a los hogares de los estudiantes que han estado viajando en el autobÃºs por las maÃ±anas. Si tiene un estudiante que no ha estado viajando en autobÃºs por las maÃ±anas, pero le gustarÃ­a participar en la entrega de desayuno y almuerzo, por favor envÃ­e un correo electrÃ³nico detallado con su nombre, el nombre del estudiante(s), y direcciÃ³n aÂ lunchrequest@kaufman-isd.netÂ Una vez que haya enviado su informaciÃ³n, su estudiante(s) se agregara a la lista de entrega por autobÃºs y las entregas comenzaran dentro de 1 o 2 dÃ­as de notificaciÃ³n. Es importante saber que para que su hijo participe en la entrega de desayuno y almuerzo por autobÃºs debe estar fisicamente presente en el momento de la entrega.

No se dejaran desayunos ni almuerzos en hogares donde no haya nadie presente. KISD le agradece por permitirnos servirle a usted y sus hijos durante este tiempo difÃ­cil. Por favor continue manteniÃ©ndose en contacto buscando actualizaciones en nuestro sitio web y recordatorios de Remind para estar al tanto de cualquier informaciÃ³n adicional.

img.alt: First page of the PDF file: Coronaviruslettertofamilies2020KISD

header.h2: Kaufman ISD Coronavirus Response Plan - Espanol 03/10/20

li.a: TEA Spring Break Guidance/Update on Coronavirus

h2.a: TEA Spring Break Guidance/Update on Coronavirus

h3.a: TEA Spring Break Guidance/Update on Coronavirus (COVID-19)

header.h2: Frequently Asked Questions regarding the Coronavirus (COVID-19)

li.a: What is the Coronavirus or COVID-19 virus?

h2.a: What is the Coronavirus or COVID-19 virus?

div.p: The Novel Coronavirus, also known as COVID-19, is a respiratory illness that can spread from person to person. The virus that causes COVID-19 is a novel coronavirus that was first identified during an investigation into an outbreak in Wuhan, China. Currently, the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports several cases in the United States, including Texas.

li.a: What are the symtoms of COVID-19?

h2.a: What are the symtoms of COVID-19?

div.p: Patients with COVID-19 have had mild to severe respiratory illness with symptoms of:

ul.li: Fever
Cough
Shortness of breath

li.a: How is the COVID-19 virus spread?

h2.a: How is the COVID-19 virus spread?

div.p: According to the CDC, the virus that causes COVID-19 belongs to a family of viruses called âcoronavirus.â There are other viruses in the coronavirus family that can cause illness in both humans and animals These viruses can cause either mild illness like a cold or can make people very sick with pneumonia. This particular coronavirus has not been seen previously in humans. The virus is likely to be spread from person to person. Since the virus is very new, health authorities continue to carefully watch how this virus spreads.

li.a: How will I know if my children have the flu or COVID-19?

h2.a: How will I know if my children have the flu or COVID-19?

div.p: While both these illnesses are respiratory viruses with symptoms of fever and a cough, it is recommended that anyone experiencing these symptoms visit a healthcare provider for diagnosis and treatment.

li.a: What can I do to prevent being infected or spreading the virus?

h2.a: What can I do to prevent being infected or spreading the virus?

ul.li: Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Â Wash your hands frequently.
Â Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth.
Â Stay home when you are sick.
Â Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissue in a covered trashcan.
Â If you do not have a tissue, use your sleeve (not your hands).
Â Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces using a regular household cleaning spray or wipe.

li.a: What is the district doing to protect students and staff?

h2.a: What is the district doing to protect students and staff?

div.p:
Kaufman ISD is following the guidance ofÂ the KaufmanÂ County Health Department, which is working closely with the CDC, local governments, and health care providers to prepare for and respond to the evolving COVID-19 situation.
Kaufman ISD Health Services has issued guidance for school nurses to use in identifying and assessing the health status of students or staff who are experiencing flu-like symptoms.Â We have full-time registered nurses employed at each of our campuses who are well prepared to deliver evidence-based, high quality medical care to our students.

li.a: What will the district do if someone at a school or office is diagnosed with COVID-19?

h2.a: What will the district do if someone at a school or office is diagnosed with COVID-19?

div.p:
If both exposure and symptoms of fever or respiratory illness are present, nurses are instructed to inform the principal, isolate the individual, and contact Kaufman ISD Health Services for additional guidance.
Where necessary, cleaning and disinfection will take place in accordance with Department of Environmental Health Services Standard Operation Procedures and KCHHS recommendations.

li.a: What are some other resources of information and updates?

h2.a: What are some other resources of information and updates?

div.div: The following resources are available to help the public stay informed about COVID-19.

ul.li: Kaufman CountyÂ Health Department

div.a: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Texas Department of State Health Services

div.p: KaufmanÂ ISD school nurses and the districtâsÂ Health Services DepartmentÂ are also trusted sources of information.

li.a: Should I or my children wear mask?

h2.a: Should I or my children wear mask?

div.div:
The CDC does not recommend that people who are well wear a facemask to protect themselves from respiratory illnesses, including COVID-19. You should only wear a mask if a healthcare professional recommends it. A facemask should be used by people who have COVID-19 and are showing symptoms. This is to protect others from the risk of getting infected. The use of facemasks also is crucial forÂ health workersÂ and otherÂ people who are taking care of someone infected with COVID-19 in close settingsÂ (at home or in a health care facility).
If you are not sick and are around someone who is sick, maintaining proper infection control such as frequent hand washing and cough etiquette is the best form of protection.

li.a: Will schools be closed if there is an outbreak of COVID_19 in Kaufman?

h2.a: Will schools be closed if there is an outbreak of COVID_19 in Kaufman?

div.div: School closures are one of several options available to district leadership to control the spread of COVID-19 if recommended by the CDC or other health authorities. Kaufman ISD will continue to monitor the progress of the illness and communicate with parents and staff on an ongoing basis.

li.a: What is being done to keep schools clean and protect students?

h2.a: What is being done to keep schools clean and protect students?

div.div: Custodial staff will perform extra cleaning of schools and district offices, and school bus drivers have been asked to clean bus interiors. If needed, the district has access to large-scale outside vendors who can deep-clean classrooms and schools. Counselors are prepared to conduct guidance lessons with students, and Information will be shared with school staffs on how to speak to students about the disease.

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window
